snippet: After a fire swept through a retirement home in L’Isle-Verte, killing dozens, Quebec is experiencing a horrible sense of déjà vu: It has been only seven months since an oil train exploded into a fireball in Lac-Mégantic, killing 47.
abstract: Residents of L’Isle-Verte, Quebec, have largely stopped speaking to reporters about fire that destroyed local retirement home, choosing instead to grieve privately as recovery workers continue to battle elements in search for victims' remains.
lead_paragraph: After a fire swept through a retirement home in L’Isle-Verte, killing dozens, Quebec is experiencing a horrible sense of déjà vu: It has been only seven months since an oil train exploded into a fireball in Lac-Mégantic, killing 47.

headline.main: Stunned by Tragedy, a Village in Rural Quebec Turns Inward
headline.print_headline: Stunned by Tragedy, a Village in Rural Quebec Turns Inward
